description: A city of northern Greece founded by Cassander of Macedon ca. 315 BC; important center of the Roman and Late Antique.

properties.description: A brick rotunda of the fourth century AD ordered by the emperor Galerius for use as either a tomb or temple; later incorporated into the Christian Church of Agios Georgios. Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1988
properties.title: Rotunda of Galerius

properties.description: A fourteenth century AD church in Thessaloniki.
properties.title: Church of Prophet Elijah

properties.description: A thirteenth/fourteenth century Byzantine bath; listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1988.
properties.title: Byzantine Bath

properties.description: An eleventh century AD Byzantine church in Thessaloniki
properties.title: Church of Panagia Chalkeon

properties.description: A fifth century AD Byzantine church
properties.title: Church of Acheiropoietos

properties.description: A seventh century AD church dedicated to the patron saint of Thessalonica; the present basilica stands on the site of a precursor with phases beginning in the fourth century AD.
properties.title: Church of Saint Demetrius

properties.description: A church to Saint Sophia dating originally from the third century AD.
properties.title: Church of Saint Sophia

properties.description: a late Byzantine church in Thessaloniki
properties.title: Church of Saint Panteleimon

properties.description: A late Byzantine church in Thessalonica
properties.title: Church of Saint Catherine

properties.description: A fourteenth century AD church in Thessalonica
properties.title: Church of St. Nicholas Orphanos

properties.description: A late fifth century AD church
properties.title: Latomos Monastery

properties.description: The extant remains of a triumphal arch, constructed from 298 to 299 CE and dedicated in 303 CE under the tetrarch Galerius. It commemorates the capture of Ctesiphon from the Sassanids and forms part of a monumental entrance to the palace of Galerius.
properties.title: Arch of Galerius
